comment: The lectures are great and easy to follow, just pay attention and try to be engaging in class and you'll do fine!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor is VERY strict. Her tests are pretty difficult too. If your looking for an easy professor, I wouldn't recommend this one! Wouldnt take her class ever again!

Do you like teaching yourself through online assignments? Do you like doing group work in nearly every class and having very little genuine lecture time when your prof does their job? Do you like having a strict attendance policy, but then having your prof cancel more classes than you're allowed to miss on your own time in the first place? Don't.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I was very disappointed with her point system. I had an A average in all categories but an 88% grade avg in the tests area (50 ques. tests), which makes up 80% of your total grade (unreasonable), I never missed class, but still ended up with an 89.8 in the class. She does not round up at all and takes her 1001 level class too serious!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Jackson is definitely strict. But she is also very passionate and funny. She makes her criteria very clear. Show up to class. She will often tell you about assignments and details in class that may not be on D2L. There are only 4 tests, the fourth one counting as your final. Shes a great teacher and a sweet lady. Definitely take her.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Class is 80% tests. If you show up and pay attention and study the tests will be super easy.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Mrs. Jackson is the BEST. She loves what she does, she is very interactive with the class, and makes sure that we all understand the topic. A lot of group work, but very easy, and not typically graded. Study and do your work and you'll pass. 4 exams, a lot of REVEL chapter questions online but you get about 2 weeks to complete each one.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Inspirational--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I really loved professor Jackson and I went to every class, was a good student, earned extra credit and even bonded with her on a personal level.......... but then she left my 89.7 at a B, so that really sucked.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you're looking for a relatively easy A, this is your professor. She explains her material very well and her tests come out of the revel assignments, which really aren't bad at all. Find the quizlet for the unit and you'll be golden. Make sure you don't skip more than four classes though, because she will start pulling points from your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mrs. Jackson is a great professor. If you wanna pass the tests, just read the textbook. Revel is all on quizlet so dont stress about the amounts of that you have to do. Shes super sweet and very helpful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: So Revel sucks, but Mrs. Jackson is a good professor and tries to make the lectures as interesting as possible. Her test of kind of hard and her study guides (if she gives you one) are just the chapter headings. Study the slides and come up with ways to apply the terms
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: LOVE Her!! Take her! She's super fun and class is never boring. She loves to talk and she knows a lot about the material. You have to purchase revel but Revel was the easiest part for me because all the answers are online on quizlet. Cant miss a lot of classes tho. And she doesn't accept any late work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: You can miss class 4 times. Final is not cumulative. Very relaxed class setting. Gives the opportunity for extra credit. Have to purchase REVEL. Ms. Jackson is very knowledgeable of the course information which made the class very easy.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The course was straight forward but the tests would display otherwise. Ms. Jackson is a sweet teacher and her lectures were fun and entertaining. The online quizzes can REALLY hurt you if you don't turn them in on time so make sure you do those and her discussion posts.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Gala Jackson is a great professor but the class is not easy A. Ended up with a 79 and she wouldn't round it up even though I didn't miss class once.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She grades based on online quizes and 5 in class tests (50 multiple choice). She isn't hard, but you have to remember to do the online quizzes and she's strict on deadlines. I barely studied for the in class tests and managed A's and B's, just skim through the material.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class itself is not hard but the way the new point system is set up makes it to where you have to really work for an A. She is a great professor, cares for her students, and doesn't make lectures boring. Revel readings suck but they help prepare for the test. Definitely take her if you want to learn more about communication!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: I thought she was a great professor. I really liked her teaching style because she didn't just lecture the entire time, but let the class discuss topics. The Revel assignments took a long time but I thought they prepared me well for the tests. Overall it wasn't a bad class, and I thought she was very helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: Ms. Jackson is amazing. However, due to the school's dumb choice of making professors use Revel, it has made the class much more difficult than it should be. I consider myself a good student (3.5) but surprisingly still got a B. If you're not a good test taker, avoid this class in general.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--TEST HEAVY

comment: I thought this class would be an easy A, I was wrong. The revel is assigned and due every two weeks, it's not difficult just VERY time consuming. The points on revel add up to be over 2,346  but it's only 50 points on your overall grade! You MUST read the book, the 4 test come straight out of it. Overall, not a bad class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Jackson is an amazing lady. She's a great teacher and you will learn a lot. However, If you are looking for a class to get an easy A, this is not the one. There is a lot of homework, and if you miss it, it hurts your grade a lot. 4 Tests the whole semester. Each requires a lot of studying if you want to do well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This class isn't one to take if you need a easy class. It takes a lot of out-of-class studying and homework is mandatory. Not much room for error when it comes to grades. If you miss more than three classes you start to loose 5pts a day. If you don't study, you won't pass; the test questions are very wordy and make all the answers seem legit.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher! Good lectures, straight-forward tests, as long as you are good at conceptualizing what you read instead of just recalling, an A is inevitable (IF AND ONLY IF YOU DO THE READING). The department-required online part of the class isn't great, but that's outside of Ms. Jackson's control.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: All you have to do is online HW that she gives you weeks ahead of time and the test are all based from the HW and vocab.  Class discussions are fun and you barely have in class assignments.  If you engage in class discussions, you'll enjoy the class a lot. On top of that she's funny and anything goes in that class, she makes you like communications

She is very nice and can be very funny. Her tests are vocab and she tells you what vocal you do and don't need to know. You do need the book, however if you actually read, it helps you understand a lot better. If you talk while she's talking, when your on your phone or laptop while she's talking she will call you out.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ms. Jackson is a wonderful teacher. She is very kind and her test are straight forward. You have to read the book but since its new its very current and interesting.  Attendance isn't mandatory but sometimes she gives in class assignments that must be turned in that day for credit. I would recommend her.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Mrs. Jackson is a great professor. She knows what she's talking about, and she likes to have class discussions so be prepared to read the chapters she assigns. She is excellent at applying the text to real-life experiences, and cracks lots of jokes. The tests are online and are vocabulary heavy so make a quizlet or something to help!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: Sense of humor
rating_tags: LECTURE HEAVY--Participation matters--Get ready to read

comment: Ms. Jackson is seriously the best! 10/10 recommend her! If you read the textbook and study vocabulary words you will get an A on every test! Don't talk during her lectures is the only thing. Great teacher overall!!!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a really good professor. She is very professional, and is a great communicator, plus she tries to make the class enjoyable with "music Mondays" and games to help us with tests. If you study, and go over the one page summaries at the end of the chapters, you will do fine on the tests. Go to class, sometimes there is homework you can miss.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Caring

comment: I loved Ms. Jackson!! She made class so fun even though it was mostly lectures. You can tell that she is excited to teach and she knows what she is talking about. 4 tests and 10 assignments, but if you do the work and read the tests are extremely easy. I would definitely take her!!
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Jackson seems like a nice lady. But she often treats her class like a group of misbehaving toddlers to get their attention. Is very verbal to insure that she is in control of her classroom. Study the definitions and you'll do fine. I wouldn't recommend her if you are easily annoyed by loud individuals.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She's so great & funny. Love her class. You absolutely have to have the textbook, and her tests are clear and mostly definitions. Study the chapters hard and you'll get an easy A. She is so bright and passionate about what she teaches, and we just had the 4 tests (non cumulative final) and a few other small assignments. Highly recommend!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Her tests are mostly definitions and examples. Pretty easy class if you study. Make sure to read the textbook because some examples in the text are on the test. Overall a good teacher.

Professor Jackson engages her student in her lectures as much as possible and she is truly passionate about what she teaches. For tests you must read the chapters. She warns her students of this. I read my chapters for the first two tests and passed with an A on both, but for the third test I foolishly did not read and made a C. Definitely take!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Mrs. Jackson is a fun professor for a great subject of Communication. She makes thinks relatable for her students. We have groups and group leaders. She can go from 0 to 100 really quick if you do something she finds disrespectful and will call you out with no shame. Her tests are literally vocabulary tests so it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Inspirational--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Jackson was a great professor! I took 13 credit hours this semester and can easily say this class was the only one that didnt stress me out. Gives random bonus points on tests for class participation!! so participate when you can. All tests are vocab and concept. definitely would take again
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Take her for an easy A, test are strictly vocabulary and concepts involving them, she is funny but can be snappy when used to the limit, she makes the class interesting, lots of group in-class activities. Overall, I recommend to anyone
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor! Tests are easy if you read the material and study vocabulary that she tells you to know. She expects participation. Lots of activities and Ted Talks in class, not a lot of lecture. High recommend, one of my favorites.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Very very nitpicky about attendance, and has a "zero-tolerance" policy for just about everything. Come to class, don't talk, or give her a wrong glance, and you should be fine!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ms. Jackson is very big on respect-while others are speaking, herself included.  Course is not hard, it helps to read.  Book is available in e-version, through Kindle app, which is helpful.  I didn't use Launchpad, but it was available for quizzes to help study for tests.  In-class assignments as well as 4 tests count for your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Tons of reading, group project at the end, only 3 tests and a few workbook pages. You get an A if you get an 85% and above. If you don't go to class, you wont pass because attendance is a part of your grade. Tests are not that bad, word for word out of the book. She posts all of the ppt slides before the test so that helps.

Ms. Jackson was great! She is so passionate about communications that it makes the class enjoyable. She will make you study hard and participate but it helps your grade overall. Make sure you read the textbook or you will not pass. She is helpful and super sweet. Take Ms. Jackson!!

DO NOT TAKE HER. Tests are unclear, everyone fails the first one. Material is not adequately covered, reads lectures off of slides ALL class period, is very late on grading EVERYTHING, and is late to class every single day. The only upside is that the material is very much common sense, so it isn't impossible to make an A in the class.

The lectures were usually entertaining.  She does not provide you with timely feedback. Attendance is mandatory, if you have more than 2 absences you get marked down a letter grade. Reading is essential to doing well in the course. The professor expects a lot from the student, but does not provide the same effort.

This has been my favorite class at KSU so far.  She's a really good teacher but you definitely need to go to class as much as you can.  Tests are hard but if you read, study, and pay attention in class you'll do just fine.  She's an awesome teacher and I definitely recommend taking her class!
I love her. Apply to be a group leader! You get 40 extra points to your FINAL grade.
Awesome professor, she is inspirational and helpful. A young successful professional and makes you want to aspire to be in her shoes. She is among Kennesaw's best.

Must Buy workbook to complete in-class assignments that do count for something ( she will let you use a piece of paper). Test are hard, 3 test 50 Questions. The questions are phrased to trick you up. A lot of the content is similar when it come to vocab. Only 4 abs allowed or you drop a letter grade. She will work with you, stiff grader, posts late

I love her to death! Take her, you'll love her too. She's very helpful. She doesn't look like a professor, more like a student. Don't underestimate her though. She gives plenty of assignments, but they are beneficial and nothing hard. Read the book before class and after class. Participate! You'll enjoy her class

She was very sweet and helpful throughout the semester. You can tell she really cares about her students. She acts like a mother in the sense that she can be nice and caring, but strict at the same time. Definitely would take again. Homework was easy, tests were a little hard if you didn't study and the final was the easiest thing EVER!
